Hi all, I recently decided to pick up NWN again after ....10? ..or so years? ...Maybe more actually, back when... I believe 20 was the cap? I might be remembering wrong and I just never got past it...maybe I'm thinking of something else? Ah well.. please forgive any mispelling or improper grammar.


My idea is I wanted to make a fighter (I think WM might compliment it, not sure). The reason its titled 'Grim Reaper' is I wanted it to use a scythe. Crazy.. I know right? I sure hope not

Anyway, I decided to find a server to call home, and decided upon the most populated one I could find (that wasn't rated 18+ cause.. I don't need to know what potentially goes on in there). So, I picked Arelith. I did some research regarding changes, and to follow in the spirit of things... I'll follow the guideline here.

1) PvM PvP - PvM, I'd rather not PvP.. but I suspect since its roleplay I will have to eventually.

2) Level Cap - 30

3) Race - Human

4) Class Preference - Fighter/WM/? (anything that makes sense with this I suppose.)

5) Melee pref - High Strength

6- Range pref- None

7 - Weapon Preference - Scythe, but... maybe a bastard sword/shield if its still essentially the same

8- Highest enchantment bonus. I'll assume +3? As that seems to be 'high tier' from the forums.

9) - Spell casting - Unless I can shoot laser beams from my hands, I doubt this would help, more only hinder

10- Custom factors - I see that devastating critical is disabled. Whirlwind attack can cause you to 'freeze' up... but I don't really see anything else that hinders. 3 levels in a row? Before picking another class.

11) Legal (PRC) Classes -
Arcane Archer
Blackguard
Champion of Torm
Dwarven Defender
Shadowdancer
Weapon Master 

...The rest are off limits or behind walls of such.



I found these changes to fighter just as I was about to submit. ...Not sure if they mean anything.
  • +1 Discipline each 3 levels.
  • +1 Strength OR Dexterity each 10 levels.
The stat bonus is Strength unless the base Dexterity is larger than the other.
  • Shield AC Bonus (+1 at 5, +2 at 25, +3 at 30)
  • Armor AC Bonus (+1 at 10, +2 at 25, +3 at 30)
  • Helmet AC Bonus (Deflection) (+1 at 15, +2 at 25, +3 at 30)
  • Weapon Attack Bonus (+1 at 20, +2 at 25, +3 at 30)
  • Weapon Damage Bonus (+1 at 20, +2 at 25, +3 at 30)
All the AC, Attack and Damage bonus stacks with equipment.

Thank you for your time. If I missed anything let me know, and I'll try to answer. (Again sorry for the english)

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Don't become too enamored by what you see on a random screenshot, Zeraxium.

Even with the limited information presented there are a few insights that can be gleaned from what's there.

First, the intrinisic AC is no higher than 61 since all the attacks are being done in Improved Expertise mode.

Next, we have no clue as to how much of the AC shown on the character screen is due to gear enhancements.  That is why all you will see in one of the guild's contributions depicts MUNDANE ratings i.e. the AC level using gear without enhancements.  It's the only way to compare apples-to-apples, if you follow me.  All of us are capable of adding the same enhancements used by every player on a server.

Let's look at a sample AC estimation based on typical gear found in a mid-magic environment.  I am choosing one based on a Level 30 WM holding a 2H weapon, in this case:

AC: 10 + 8hvy armor +1dex mod +6tum +2as +1dodge feat = 28 (+8 with arm shots x4)

Now, to that we'll add the typical gear enhancements:

Armor bonus +5
Shield bonus +0 (2H weapon)
Boots bonus +5 (dodge AC)
Cloak bonus +5 (deflection AC)
Ammy bonus +5 (natural AC)
Haste +4 (dodge effect AC)
Total bonus 29

Total AC: intrinsic + enhancements = 28 + 29 = 57 AC (67 ImpExpertise mode).  An s/s config would have netted another +8 AC, bringing the totals up to 65 (75).

So, I'm betting the screenshot depicts an s/s config especially looking at the damage totals, quite low for a 2H weapon.

The strategy behind battling with a 2H weapon is different than standing there flailing while holding a shield.  It's all about damage and dispatching your foe quickly before it has a chance to roll lots of crits.  You'll use a ranged weapon to pull mobs apart and then go mano-a-mano vs. each one in melee.

A Level 30 bardic scythemaster with intrinsic STR 26 has the following damage potential while holding a mundane scythe:

mundane scythe pierce/slash
damage per hit:
 2d4 2-8 + 12 + 6 + 2bs= 22 - 28 crit 17-20x5 110-140

Add to that the bonus from reaching the ability cap with Bull pots and gear results in:
2d4 2-8 + 21 + 6 + 2bs= 31 - 37 crit 17-20x5 155-185

Add to that a +5 weapon enhancement, enough to pierce DR effects like Stoneskin:
2d4 2-8 + 21 + 6 + 2bs + 5 = 36 - 42 crit 17-20x5 180-210

So, at that potential 2 or 3 crits is enough to dispatch any foe with less than 600-ish HP.

Here's a no-frills, basic scythemaster for you to peruse and use for comparison's sake in your quest for a best-fit:

Scythemaster 30 - Fighter 10 /Weapon Master 16 /Bard 4,  Any non-lawful Human
Spoiler [+]

STR: 16 (26)
DEX: 13**
CON: 16
WIS: 8
INT: 13**
CHA: 8

02: Ftr(2): Dodge
03: Ftr(3): Expertise
04: Ftr(4): STR+1 (17), WS: Scythe
05: Ftr(5)
06: Ftr(6): Spring Attack, Mobility
07: Ftr(7)
08: Ftr(8): STR+1 (18), WWA
09: WM(1): ImpCrit: Scythe, WoC: Scythe
10: WM(2)
11: WM(3)
12: WM(4): STR+1(19), Called Shot
13: WM(5)
14: WM(6)
15: WM(7): KD [PvP]*
16: WM(8): STR+1 (20)
17: WM(9)
18: WM(10): IKD [PvP]*
19: Brd(1)
20: Brd(2): STR+1 (21)
21: Brd(3): Grt STR (22)
22: WM(11)
23: WM(12)
24: WM(13): STR+1 (23), Grt STR (24), EWF: Scythe
25: WM(14)
26: WM(15)
27: Ftr(9): Grt STR (25)
28: Ftr(10): STR+1 (26), EWS: Scythe
29: WM(16): Armor Skin
30: Brd(4): Epic Prowess

* For PvM, you can opt for Power Attack/Cleave,  Disarm/ImpDisarm is also worth considering for PvP but will only gain +4AB vs. holders of small weapons.  Vs. medium weapons will be a wash.

** With the gifting system, you may want to take INT+2 and slide the odd point over to DEX to increase your reflex by 1 (i.e. start with DEX 14, INT 14).  After the gift applies, you'll be able to max Listen which is a key weakness of the current skill set and perhaps add 5 more to the spellcraft dump.  The other is saves, typical of most WMs.  You'll be eating that weakness.

Skills: 140 - Discipline 33(41), Intimidate 4(3), Perform 10(9), Spellcraft 24(25), Taunt 33(32), Tumble 30(31), UMD 2(1) [good for divine scrolls up to 1K gold value

HP, max: 374
Saves F/W/R: 17/12/18 (22/17/23 vs spells)
BAB: 24 (4 APR)
AB (max, naked, mundane): 39 (scythe), 26 (ranged)
AC (naked/mundane hvy armor/mundane armor+shield only): 19/27/30

AB potential, mundane scythe: 39 +1bs +6tnt = 46

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
You mean WM 7?  That's automatic.  There is no choice involved on the part of the player.

That's how you get to a 17-20 crit range for the scythe.  ImpCrit on a 20 range extends it to 19-20 and then Ki Crit adds 2 more.  The damage estimates I provided already spell that much out.

This build will generate somewhere around 50-55 AB with the max weapon enhancement you've described (+4), some +STR gear/buff, the bard song and successful taunting.  If you can't hit creatures regularly with that much (that would be 75+ AC), it's time to build an AA than can hit up to 100 AC.  Only a divine fighter can exceed the WM's melee AB but that requires buffing and you've already decided that imbuing an attack via divine means is not on your short list.  Depending on Improved Expertise pretty much destroys your AB (just like as depicted in that screenie).  However, the standard Expertise/Taunt combo will generate both +5 AC and +1AB over a standard attack.

If you mean "Ki Damage"... then meh... it's more trouble than it's worth IMO.  You need to time the attempt on the first attack of the flurry to stand much chance of getting extra damage. If your weapon contains others damage enhancements, Ki damage will ignore those (feel free to test it yourself if you are skeptical).  But if you like the idea, go for it.  I'm too busy attempting KD and arm shots both of which will drastically change the course of the battle.

posts.content:
Actually, I made a taunting PBS version of such a beast for a party of well-endowed companions that I could rely on to watch my back (Stagmeister never saw this one.  Very hard to play.)  that tips the scale at AB 88 (AB: 58 +6 cap dex +1bs +1pbs +4 (leg shotx4) + 1bless +1aid +3 divfav +4divpwr + 1pray +2btide = 82 +6tnt = 88).  But it is bred for only a single purpose, very stupid and one-dimensional ("Me shute da bow gud! ").  I'm guessing with the loss of 5 BAB in epic, several lost opportunities for Grt DEX and fewer AA levels possible,  Arelith will significantly nerf the build.  The gifts may help but not that much. However, the fact that a ranger can automatically become an AA provides some atypical room for experimentation. 

So who really knows what ceiling is possible until you've completed the 3-credit course reading the Arelith manual?
